title: When institutional reliability matters: the story of di-ethylene glycol
description: India’s encounter with DEG has occurred at multiple points over the past four decades, leaving behind a trail of deaths. The lesson here is to build credible government institutions that can safeguard public health

title: Gaza's Rafah border crossing reopened but few people have crossed
description: Over the first four days of operations, just 36 Palestinians requiring medical care were allowed to leave for Egypt, plus 62 companions, according to United Nations data

title: Police arrest protesters at Minneapolis federal building on 1-month anniversary of woman's death
description: Renee Good was killed on January 7 as she was driving away from immigration officers in a Minneapolis neighbourhood

description: No party is forecast to win an outright majority, and coalition negotiations are expected to follow the results.

title: 27 deaths later, Meghalaya orders massive crackdown on rat-hole mines
Four Indian students stabbed in Russia; teen suspect linked to neo-Nazi organisation
description: A 15-year-old, allegedly linked to a banned neo-Nazi group, stabbed at least six people, including four Indian students, at a Russian university dormitory. The attacker reportedly shouted Holocaust-related slogans and drew a Swastika with victims' blood. He also injured two police officers and himself before being apprehended.

title: Hyderabad scientists identify metabolic trigger behind deadly fungal infections
Moolamppilly package: revenue officials dismiss need for monthly meetings
description: Revenue officials say there was no decision to hold monthly meetings of the MPMC. Evictee groups, however, point to earlier meeting minutes and court directions while flagging delays in rehabilitation and compensation.

description: Takaichi is hugely popular, but the ruling Liberal Democratic Party, which has governed Japan for most of the last seven decades, is not

description: The U.S. Homeland Security Adviser has shaped President Donald Trump’s most inflammatory immigration initiatives

title: Morning Digest: Farmers’ body seeks Goyal’s resignation over U.S. trade deal; West Bengal CEO seeks one-week extension for SIR deadline; and more
description: Here is a select list of stories to start the day

description: Haryana Tourism Minister Arvind Sharma, who visited the accident spot, said that directions were issued for a thorough investigation of the entire incident and assured strict action against the culprits

description: Jack Lang has been summoned to report on February 8 to the Foreign Ministry, which supervises the Arab World Institute, a cultural and research institution ‌that promotes understanding of the Arab world

’We will pay,’ Savannah Guthrie says in desperate video plea to potential kidnappers of her mother

'Border 2' crosses Rs 300 crore mark in India
description: Sunny Deol's 'Border 2' has crossed the Rs 300 crore mark domestically, reaching approximately Rs 301.5 crore. The war film's worldwide collection stands at around Rs 412 crore, with overseas earnings of Rs 52 crore.

title: Two arrested for gang rape of spa worker in Kerala town
Happy Propose Day 2026: Top 30+ Romantic Wishes Images, Quotes, WhatsApp Status, Wallpapers, Greetings Card, Photos For Your Love
IS owns up 'suicide attack' on Pakistan Shia mosque; toll now 36
description: The Islamic State has claimed responsibility for a deadly blast at a Shia mosque in Islamabad, which resulted in over three dozen casualties. The terror outfit's mouthpiece stated the attack was a Fidayeen operation by a soldier of the Islamic State in Pakistan Province. This claim comes amidst growing sectarian tensions and an IS call for Lashkar-e-Taiba members to defect.

title: March 2026 deadline around the corner, 51 Maoists surrender in Sukma, Bijapur
‘Kerala always felt like home’: Britain-born Pepita Seth is now an Indian citizen
‘Voters registered at multiple booths’: UP minister questions SIR in constituency
Delhi biker death case: Contractor who’d dug pit came, saw and left as victim lay there for hours
description: A 25-year-old biker died after falling into a 14-foot pit in Janakpuri. The sub-contractor who dug the pit was arrested after he allegedly saw the victim and left without calling for help. The pit was dug just hours before the accident, with no warning signs or barricades.

title: Proposed Bill on menstrual leave in Karnataka put on the back burner
description: It was proposed to introduce the Bill during the last Winter session in Belagavi, but it was not done so; meanwhile, a Government Order on the one-day menstrual leave per month has been questioned in the Karnataka High Court

title: India, US reach interim deal: Surat’s gems and jewellery industry hopes to bring the bling back
Epstein files: Veteran French politician steps down as head of prestigious institute after documents reveal links to Jeffrey Epstein
Delhi court seeks police report on plea against promoters of 32nd Milestone project in Gurgaon
Academic year nearly over, MCD school students yet to receive financial aid to buy uniform, bag
Urge parents to monitor use of mobile phones among children: UP women’s panel chief after deaths of Ghaziabad sisters
'Should've sent Pak home': Netherlands left distraught after defeat in tense match
description: The Netherlands felt they lost their T20 World Cup opener against Pakistan due to poor execution in the final overs, not Pakistan outplaying them. A dropped catch and missed opportunities allowed Faheem Ashraf to change the game, securing a Pakistan victory. Despite the disappointment, the team remains proud of their fight and looks to their next match.

title: Suryakumar scripts history, triggers Netravalkar's worst-ever T20I WC spell
description: India's T20 World Cup opener saw a dramatic turnaround, with Suryakumar Yadav's unbeaten 84 off 49 balls rescuing the team from a precarious 77 for 6. His captain's knock, the second-highest debut score in T20 World Cup history, guided India to a competitive total despite a costly spell from Saurabh Netravalkar.

title: ‘His bravery saved many lives’: Cop who died amid Surajkund fair swing collapse rescue op would have retired in March
Trade deal: Aviation suppliers eye greater access to US
description: A landmark Indo-US trade deal is poised to significantly boost India's aerospace exports, potentially doubling sourcing for giants like Boeing. Zero-duty access for components will place India on par with established aerospace supply chains, with Indian carriers expected to place substantial aircraft orders.

title: Trade deals should be on our terms, not under anybody’s pressure: Mohan Bhagwat
‘Humiliating’: Allahabad High Court sets aside placard punishment handed to Noida varsity student
description: A single-Judge Bench mandated the student to stand at the campus gate for 30 days carrying a placard declaring, “I will never misbehave with any girl”

title: Mysterious gas leak causes panic in Jammu; probe launched to identify nature of substance
description: Several residents of Rani Bagh complained of breathlessness following the sudden leakage of gas from an abandoned cylinder lying at the scrap dealer’s premises, say officials

title: Trade deal: US whiskey, wine unlikely to give headache to Indian cos
description: Duty concessions on American whiskey and wine are unlikely to significantly impact Indian companies due to minimum import prices and low existing volumes. American whiskey holds less than 0.1% of the Indian market, with distinct flavors appealing to a niche segment. Similarly, imported wines face distribution challenges, with Australian wines leading the small segment.

title: Dramatic turnaround: From brink of collapse, PM Modi & Trump deliver a deal
description: India and the US have reached a breakthrough interim trade agreement, a significant shift from recent tensions. This deal, a precursor to a larger pact, offers advantages to India's MSME and labor-intensive sectors. Negotiators successfully resisted pressure on sensitive agricultural imports, a move likely to please the US president's base ahead of mid-term polls.

title: The $500 billion question: What will India import from US?
description: India aims to import $500 billion in US goods over five years, but success hinges on American suppliers meeting demand.  While oil and coal imports are set to rise, high-tech items like chips and aircraft face supply chain challenges.  Indian buyers and US sellers must collaborate to achieve this ambitious trade target.

title: Forgetting Hindu sentiments led to Partition: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat
description: “We said we respect all religions because we are Hindus. There are people who say this was wrong. Islam and Christianity still exist in India. There are skirmishes, but the country has remained united,” says Bhagwat

title: India-US trade deal: Farmers question import of animal feed, soybean oil
description: India's decision to import animal feed like DDGs and soybean oil from the US has sparked farmer concerns, who fear the products originate from genetically modified crops. While the government assures that all domestic crops remain safe and GM traces are eliminated post-processing, farm organizations are seeking greater clarity on the agreement's implications for local agriculture and farmer incomes.

title: ‘Unblock our lives’ | Women gig workers protest in Delhi
description: The women partners of service provider Urban Company are protesting against the lack of flexibility, a promise that initially pulled them in. They speak about being stuck in a loop of algorithmic exploitation and constant surveillance

title: India stands its ground on dairy, agri products
description: India has reached a trade agreement with the US on agricultural products. Tariffs will be reduced on several American food items like tree nuts and fruits. However, India will maintain protection for its dairy and genetically modified crops. This deal aims to balance trade interests for both nations, opening new avenues for Indian exports.

title: Israel says Netanyahu will meet with Trump about Iran talks on February 11
description: The U.S. and the Islamic Republic of Iran held indirect talks on February 6 in Oman that appeared to return to the starting point on how to approach discussions over Tehran’s nuclear programme

title: Abbas Araghchi | The diplomat on a tightrope
description: Iran’s Foreign Minister faces the daunting task of finding a diplomatic way out of tensions with the U.S. without compromising key national security interests at a time when the economy struggles and internal tensions remain high after the January crackdown

title: Congress calls pact a surrender, says something being hidden
description: Congress criticized the India-US trade deal framework as a "surrender," citing concerns over unspecified "additional products" for tariff reductions. Leaders argued the deal is heavily tilted towards the US and will negatively impact farmers, highlighting a lack of transparency in the agreement's details.

title: US deal boosts India's growth engine: Amit Shah
description: India and the United States have reached an interim trade agreement. This deal is expected to boost India's economic growth and manufacturing sector. Government leaders stated that the agreement safeguards the nation's core interests. It aims to create more jobs and opportunities for farmers, entrepreneurs, and businesses across the country.

title: Trust has become India's strongest currency: PM Modi
description: Prime Minister Modi highlighted recent trade agreements with the US and other nations as proof of growing global trust in India. He emphasized the country's shift from a mere market to an investment and trade hub, fostering 'Make in India' and creating jobs. These deals, he stated, reflect a dynamic partnership and commitment to innovation and shared prosperity.

title: 'Politically motivated': Sonia Gandhi slams plea over 1980 voter list inclusion
description: Sonia Gandhi Saturday termed a criminal revision petition against a magisterial order as "politically motivated and frivolous." The petition alleges her name was included in electoral rolls in 1980 using forged documents, despite her acquiring Indian citizenship later. Gandhi argued citizenship and electoral roll issues fall outside criminal court jurisdiction.

title: Interests of Indian farmers ‘completely protected’ in Indo-U.S. trade deal: Shivraj Singh Chouhan
description: The reduced 18% tariffs will help Indian basmati rice find more market in the world, says Minister

title: Trust has become India’s strongest currency: PM Modi in Malaysia
Tamil literature is eternal and its culture global, PM Modi says in Malaysia
description: Prime Minister Modi lauded Tamil culture at a Kuala Lumpur event, highlighting its global reach and the significant presence of Tamilians in India's leadership. He announced UPI's upcoming availability in Malaysia and the opening of India's first consulate there, strengthening bilateral ties and community outreach. Modi also pledged a new Thiruvalluvar Centre to honor shared heritage.

title: Bengal CM stole limelight, despite me being original petitioner: CPI(M)’s Mostari Banu
description: Mostari Banu, who hails from Bhagwangola in Murshidabad and is associated with the CPI(M), said it was in response to her petition that the Supreme Court issued directions on January 19 to the ECI

title: Govt spent barely 40% of Budget on biggest schemes in 9 months
description: Government spending on major schemes lags significantly, with only 41.2% of the budgeted amount disbursed in the first nine months. Revised estimates for 47 out of 53 large projects are lower than initially planned. Several key initiatives, including the Jal Jeevan Mission, show drastically reduced spending, raising concerns about project execution and fund utilization.

title: Kangayam GH far from complying with manpower, infrastructure needs as per IPHS 2022 norms
Strategic Forces Command successfully test-fires 3,000 km-range Agni-3 missile
description: India successfully test-fired its nuclear-capable Agni-3 ballistic missile, boasting a 3,000-km range, from Chandipur, Odisha. The surface-to-surface missile, launched from a mobile launcher as part of a regular training exercise, validated all operational and technical parameters. This test reinforces India's robust nuclear deterrent capabilities.

title: Ahead of Macron’s visit, DAC likely to meet next week to approve deal for 114 Rafales
description: India's Defence Acquisition Council is set to consider a major proposal to purchase 114 Rafale fighter jets from France for approximately Rs 3.25 lakh crore. This significant procurement, with a substantial portion to be manufactured in India, aims to bolster the Indian Air Force's fighter squadron strength amidst rising regional security concerns.

title: How is India tackling mental health crisis? | Explained
description: What has the Budget allocated for mental health institutions? Will it be enough to tackle an emergency?

title: Govt. to flag off 500 e-buses to mark year in power: CM
Chief Secretary orders citywide safety review of construction works
MCD Commissioner’s project approval limit increased to ₹50 cr.
Gujarat CM lays foundation stone for first phase of Shakti Corridor
Subcontractor arrested for not reporting accident that led to motorcyclist’s death
description: Role of company owner and workers involved in the project being probed; AAP seeks Delhi Police Commissioner’s suspension, says govt. tried to project that the man himself jumped into the pit along with his motorcycle; police deny lapses, say they helped the family

title: India, US discuss ways to boost collaboration in critical, emerging defence tech
description: India and the US convened in New Delhi to bolster cooperation in cutting-edge defence technologies. The 24th Indo-US Joint Technical Group Plenary Meeting focused on enhancing joint research and development, involving universities, labs, and industries. Discussions aimed to address evolving defence needs and explore new collaborative avenues, culminating in a project agreement.

title: Over 1.7 crore tourists, including 36,000 foreigners, visited J&K in 2025: Govt
description: Jammu & Kashmir welcomed over 1.7 crore tourists in 2025, including more than 36,000 international visitors. While no specific targets are set for 2026, the government is actively working to boost tourist numbers through various initiatives. The Home Stay program has proven successful and is slated for expansion, despite facing challenges like awareness and infrastructure gaps.

title: Why is Dreamliner’s fuel system under watch? | Explained
description: What happened on a recent Air India flight? Why are certain fuel control switches malfunctioning? Weren’t precautionary checks undertaken after the Ahmedabad mishap in June last year? What is the risk it poses to the engine when switches are faulty?

title: As Union govt. gave ‘nothing’ to T.N. in Budget, NDA should be given a ‘zero’ in polls: Stalin
description: Tamil Nadu has been ranked number one in the Centre’s ratings under DMK rule; despite this, the BJP-led Union govt. has not offered the poll-bound State any benefits in the Budget, the Chief Minister says

title: Yumnam Khemchand Singh | Crisis-time CM
description: The new BJP Chief Minister of Manipur has to take measures to heal the ethnic wounds while navigating administrative challenges

title: Amit Shah reviews development projects, reaffirms Modi govt’s push for prosperous J&K
description: Union home minister Amit Shah reviewed Jammu and Kashmir's development projects. He also stressed hydropower potential and welfare scheme saturation. Aggressive tourism marketing and sports infrastructure development were highlighted. The region will receive 50-year interest-free loans for capital projects. The government aims for a developed Jammu and Kashmir by 2047.

title: BJP mocks NC’s ‘special status’ call for J&K, says no return of Article 370
description: BJP leader Sunil Sharma challenged the National Conference's demand for Jammu and Kashmir's "special status," stating the term is not in the Indian Constitution. Sunil Sharma argued that Article 370, which NC claims defined this status, has been "buried," dismissing the demand as baseless and accusing NC of misleading voters.

title: Purnea MP arrested in 31-year-old case, sent to two-day judicial custody
description: Opposition leaders criticise late-night action against Pappu Yadav, who has been highlighting the alleged death and rape of a medical aspirant in Patna; court to hear bail plea tomorrow

title: 'I don't do 50/50': Kayla Nicole opens up on finances with Travis Kelce
description: While Travis Kelce moved on in his life with Taylor Swift, his ex girlfriend, popular social media influencer, Kayla Nicole's controversial statements about how she managed finances while dating the star player have sparked chaos. Over the last few years, Kayla Nicole has also been brutally trolled for allegedly making subtle digs at Travis Kelce and Taylor Swift's high profile relationship.

title: Mavericks vs Spurs injury report: Playing status, head-to-head, stats & more
description: The Dallas Mavericks will play the San Antonio Spurs on February 7, 2026. San Antonio is in strong form while Dallas faces significant injury issues. The Spurs have won both previous meetings this season. Player availability will be crucial in this matchup. This game offers Dallas a chance to gauge progress against a top Western Conference team.

title: Penalties, warnings fail to curb wrong-side driving on city roads
description: Police should conduct a special drive, raise awareness to prevent such violations, say residents; traffic police official says they have identified 230 spots where people are prone to drive on wrong side, and have installed cameras to issue challans

4 Indian students injured in knife attack in Russia
Regional finale of Cerebration Corporate Quiz on Sunday
T20 World Cup: Spin-heavy Afghanistan eyes New Zealand scalp
description: Rashid & Co. will aim to emulate their 2024 edition heroics; the batting unit, led by Zadran and Gurbaz, needs to pull its weight if the team has to go deep in the tournament; the Kiwis will be keen on bouncing back from the drubbing in the recent series against India

title: SIR: Activists flag concerns over voter roll mapping

description: Harry Brook faced a financial penalty and a final warning from the England and Wales Cricket Board after an altercation with a bouncer in Wellington

title: 3,617 govt. schools closed in Karnataka between 2020-21 and 2025-26
Ofcom revokes TV licences of Overseas Friends of BJP (UK) president
description: UK's Ofcom has revoked broadcasting licences for MATV National and MATV Music, held by Middlesex Broadcasting Corporation Limited. The regulator determined that MATV Broadcasting Ltd, where Kuldeep Shekhawat is a director, exercised editorial control, not the licence holder. Ofcom cited Shekhawat's role as president of Overseas Friends of BJP (UK) as a potential disqualification due to political affiliations.

title: Davis Cup: Big-serving Dhakshineswar helps India pull level against the Netherlands
Two dead, several feared trapped as three-storey building collapses in Rajasthan’s Kota
description: Local MLA Sandeep Sharma, who reached the spot soon after the incident, said the building collapsed suddenly and there was a possibility that more people were trapped under the debris

title: Top PIO restaurateur found guilty of spiking woman’s drink at Annabel’s in Mayfair
description: An Indian-origin restaurateur, owner of Michelin-starred Benares, has been convicted of drugging a woman's cocktail at Annabel's with intent to overpower her for sex. Staff intervened, preventing her from drinking the spiked 'Spicy Margarita' laced with GBL. Police found GBL traces in a vanilla extract bottle and at his home.

title: Mohammed Siraj on his late T20 World Cup call-up: ‘I was to go to Spain to watch Real Madrid football game… this feels like a dream’
Youth arrested for stalking, threatening college student in Triplicane
Zaman S. Khan wins Kochi round of The Hindu BusinessLine Cerebration Corporate Quiz 2026
description: Khan will now represent Kochi at the grand finale scheduled to be held at the BSE, Mumbai, on February 21

title: Minister opens memorial pillar for Mordhana dam in Vellore for completion of 25 years

‘Every child in conflict is one in need of protection’
Suryakumar Yadav reveals how he sculpted India’s comeback from 77/6 vs USA in T20 World Cup: ‘Gauti bhai told me, just bat till the end’
Shia Muslims protest in Kashmir over deadly blast at Islamabad mosque
description: Kashmiri Shia Muslims held protests across the region condemning a suicide bombing at a mosque in Islamabad. The attack killed over 30 people during Friday prayers. Demonstrations occurred in Srinagar, Baramulla, and Bandipora. Protesters voiced anger against the Pakistani government and expressed solidarity with the victims. Some raised slogans supporting Syed Hassan Nasrallah, Palestine, and Hezbollah.

title: ‘In my shoes’: Mira Kapoor gives us a glimpse into her footwear wardrobe
DMK MP moves Bill seeking reservation in higher judiciary
description: DMK MP P Wilson in his private member’s bill argued that the current composition of the higher judiciary is not representative of the country’s social diversity.

title: 27-storey landmark takes shape at Central Square, to be ready in 2027
description: CMRL officials say nearly 20% of the work has been completed; the ₹350-crore building will house a rooftop hotel, office spaces, retail outlets, and a multiplex; it will be linked to the Central Metro Rail Station and Park Town MRTS station

title: Suryakumar Yadav wins 17th Player of the Match award, breaks Kohli’s T20I record

Budget allocates ₹30 crore for SMA treatment

Three held for land fraud using forged documents in Chennai
Water supply to be affected in two zones in north Chennai on February 9
Two killed, five injured in car crash on ORR near Pocharam
ISL 2025/26 fixtures announced: Mohun Bagan SG face Kerala Blasters in opening match on February 14, Kolkata derby on May 3
International symposium on Parkinson’s disease in Thiruvananthapuram
Sabari rail: govt. steps rekindle hopes among people along proposed corridor
description: The project is on the right track, with the State govt. deciding to bear 50% of the cost, including land acquisition expenses, and the Railway Ministry de-freezing the project, say officials

title: 'We could've batted better': SKY makes honest admission after USA win
description: India start their T20 World Cup with a 29-run win over the USA, recovering from 77/6 thanks to captain Suryakumar Yadav’s unbeaten 84 off 49 balls. SKY admitted, "We could've batted a little better," praising his Mumbai experience and coach Gautam Gambhir’s advice. Bowlers Siraj, Arshdeep, and Axar restricted the USA to 132/8, securing a hard-fought victory.

title: PARD announces free competitive exam coaching for underprivileged students
DGGI arrests man for utilising fake GST input tax credit
New barricades installed under Raidurg Metro to regulate pedestrian crossings
YSRCP leaders take part in ‘Chalo Guntur’, express solidarity with Rambabu
description: Former Minister Gudivada Amarnath alleges political vendetta behind attack on Ambati Rambabu’s residence, says Kapu leaders will fight repression and misuse of Tirumala laddu issue for politics

title: A book on what it means to be a doctor
description: The golden jubilee anniversary of the batch of doctors who graduated from Madras Medical College in 1975 was celebrated recently

title: Surya rescues India in thrilling escape from plucky USA
Versace didn’t look far for its next designer
134-year-old Sir M.Ct. M Higher Secondary School  calls on its alumni
description: The school management hosted old students for the first alumni meet held on January 26 in its campus in Purasawalkam

title: Three-storeyed building collapses in Rajasthan's Kota; 2 killed, several feared trapped
description: A three-storey building housing a restaurant collapsed in Kota, Rajasthan, killing at least two people and leaving several others feared trapped. Rescue operations are underway, with five individuals already rescued and hospitalized. The incident occurred in the Talwandi area, and authorities are working to ascertain the full extent of casualties.

title: SIR woes continue on the last day of hearing in West Bengal
description: The Trinamool Congress highlights the plight of people, including incidents such as death of two people on the way to the hearing centre. The BJP alleges ‘hooliganism’ by the ruling party at the hearing centres.

title: T20 WC: India survive USA test; register 29-run win with Suryakumar's heroics
description: India secured a 35-run victory against the USA in their T20 World Cup opener. Despite a shaky batting performance, Suryakumar Yadav's unbeaten 84 guided India to 161. Arshdeep Singh and Mohammed Siraj then dismantled the USA's top order, setting up a comfortable win for the hosts.

title: Manchester United win again to make it four wins in a row for new coach Michael Carrick
Mumbai Open: Sawangkaew sets up title clash with Tagger
Suryakumar Yadav’s rescue act powers India to nervy 29-run win over USA in T20 World Cup opener
Young Indians plant fruit-bearing saplings around restored waterbody in Madurai

description: Students of 1975-1976 batch of Seventh Day Adventist School in Vepery meet up on the campus and renew old bonds

title: Work at Mithi river takes a hit: No desilting in 8 stretches for 6 months
ED case against former home minister: Discharge plea of firm linked with son rejected
‘Adequate sanitation facilities a basic human right under Article 21′: HC directs BMC to provide sufficient toilets in Mumbai slums
'Tracked her movements': How a UP man helped Bengaluru techie murder his wife
description: Bengaluru police arrested a 32-year-old man from Varanasi for allegedly assisting software engineer Balamurugan in his wife's murder by tracking her live location. Abhimanyu Singh, an assistant to a gold merchant, was taken into custody for his role in the conspiracy. He allegedly shared the victim's movements with Balamurugan, enabling the murder.

title: An enduring love for erasers and sharpeners
description: Anuradha Shekher is finding a new space for her collection of erasers, shifting them from Mandaveli to California

title: ‘I did not sleep the whole night’: Under-19 World Cup hero Vaibhav Sooryavanshi opens up on final pressure before historic 175
People raised in State-run orphanages and charity homes struggle with SIR rules on parent mapping
description: ECI officials have said orphanage’s name should be entered in the column for parents, but lack of specific guidelines leads to chaos on the ground; with no lineage proof, State must provide needed documentation

title: Ram Madhav’s first meeting hints at BJP high command-driven campaign for GBA polls; MLAs upset
description: Madhav suggests that polls in each of the five corporations will be held under a ‘prabhari’ from the party, to ensure accountability

title: Watch: Vijay holds ‘shooting-style’ events without ideology: K. Veeramani
BJP claims Union govt. has put metro fare hike on hold; BMRCL says no such direction
description: We can decide only when official communication comes to us. So far, we have not received any communication, says a BMRCL official

title: AINRC workers could approach voters with confidence, says Rangasamy
description: Addressing party workers during AINRC’s foundation day celebrations at ECR, Chief Minister Rangasamy says they can go to voters with confidence as we most of the assurances given to the voters are fulfilled

title: Watch: Fire at Telangana Forensic Science Laboratory damages crucial evidence; probe under way
description: A fire broke out at the Telangana Forensic Science Laboratory in Nampally, Hyderabad, on Saturday morning, damaging crucial case evidence stored on the first floor.

title: After 44 yrs, BJP takes the helm in Mumbai: Tawde set to become mayor unopposed
CPI urges govt to rectify deficiencies in functioning of PTU

'Khejri Bachao Andolan': Why Rajasthan is rallying to protect its 'Kalpavriksha'
description: A significant protest is under way in Rajasthan over the felling of the khejri tree. Communities are demanding stronger protection for the state tree, alleging that it is being cut to make way for solar power projects. Political leaders across parties have joined the movement, drawing attention to the tree’s cultural and ecological significance. In an arid landscape where survival is closely tied to ecology, the debate in western Rajasthan now extends beyond development to questions of history, identity and survival.

title: MLB trade rumours: Reds tipped to land $10.2m Yankees slugger to boost title odds
description: Cincinnati Reds are eyeing Jazz Chisholm Jr. to bolster their lineup, potentially trading pitcher Brady Singer and infielder Matt McLain. Chisholm offers proven power and speed, addressing the Reds' offensive struggles. The Yankees, seeking pitching depth and infield versatility, might consider the deal to manage future payroll. This move could boost Cincinnati's playoff hopes.

title: SpaceX 'hiring problem': Elon Musk says engineers not ready to relocate
description: SpaceX faces a significant hurdle in attracting engineers and technicians to its Starbase facility in South Texas due to limited job prospects for their spouses. Elon Musk highlighted this 'significant other' problem, noting the remote location's scarcity of non-SpaceX employment. This challenge, though less severe, also impacts Tesla's recruitment in Texas, contrasting with easier relocations from California's job-rich areas.

title: ‘In 36 months, the cheapest place to put AI will be …’: Musk makes a bold prediction
description: Elon Musk predicts space will become the most cost-effective location for AI data centers within three years. He cited advantages like five times greater solar panel efficiency, no need for batteries due to constant sunlight, and the absence of atmospheric interference.

title: Elon Musk denies Starlink phone: CEO says no device in works
description: Elon Musk has officially denied reports of SpaceX developing a Starlink phone, stating "We are not developing a phone." This clarification comes amidst speculation about the satellite internet business's expansion ahead of a potential IPO. Musk has previously expressed strong reluctance towards phone manufacturing.

title: With a banjo on my wall
description: On February 8, 1802, horologist Simon Willard received a patent for what is popularly known as a banjo clock. A clockmaker of repute in the U.S., Willard worked his hands on the hands of many a clock. A.S.Ganesh tells you what made him and his clocks tick…
